title: Andrew Griggs guilty of murdering pregnant wife, Debbie, who disappeared 20-years ago without trace
text:
A married sailor, who was having an affair with a 15-year-old girl, has been convicted of killing his pregnant wife who disappeared without trace 20-years ago.

Debbie Griggs, a devoted mother-of-three, went missing from the Kent home she shared with husband, Andrew, on May 5, 1999 and has never been seen since.

At the time of her disappearance she was pregnant with the couple's fourth child and Griggs, insisted she had simply walked out following a row.

But yesterday the 57-year-old was found guilty of her murder after a jury at Canterbury Crown Court was told he was suspected of having a sexual relationship with a 15-year-old girl at around the same time his wife went missing.

During the trial, Duncan Atkinson QC, prosecuting, said Debbie's body had never been located, but her car had been found abandoned not far from her home in Deal.

He told the trial: "The prosecution case is that Debbie Griggs did not just up and leave her husband and children in the middle of the night, never to be seen or heard of again.

"She was a devoted mother who would not have just abandoned her children."
description: A married sailor, who was having an affair with a 15-year-old girl, has been convicted of killing his pregnant wife who disappeared without trace 20-years ago.
